intro: Agrostophyllum graminifolium, commonly known as the grass-leafed agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations in tropical ecosystems.
